wikipedia_page.main: Susan Howson (born 1973) is a British mathematician whose research is in the fields of algebraic number theory and arithmetic geometry.

response: James Clerk Maxwell and Sir William Hodge. The first time it was awarded to a female mathematician was in 2002 when it was awarded to Susan Howson, then a lecturer at the University of Nottingham for her work on number theory and elliptic curves.

link_mentions.page: List of University of Nottingham people
response: * Susan Howson – first female winner of the Adams Prize (for mathematics)
* Susan Howson (born 1973), British mathematician known for work on algebraic number theory and arithmetic geometry

link_mentions.page: List of people by Erdős number

response: 2002: Susan Howson became the first woman to win the Adams Prize, given annually by the University of Cambridge to a British mathematician under the age of 40.
